summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from December 3, 2019, discussing a media inquiry from a Norwegian journalist. The inquiry concerns whether the FBI is interested in speaking with a Norwegian citizen (name redacted) and Crown Princess Mette-Marit in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, based on a tip to the FBI's Stockholm suboffice. The emails show FBI personnel in New York and Copenhagen coordinating their response.

persons.name: Runa Fjellanger
persons.context: Norwegian journalist from VG newspaper who emailed the FBI's National Press Office to inquire about the FBI's alleged interest in a Norwegian citizen and Crown Princess Mette-Marit regarding the Epstein case.

persons.name: Crown Princess Mette-Marit
persons.context: Named in the journalist's inquiry as someone the FBI was reportedly interested in speaking with regarding Jeffrey Epstein, according to media reports.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI investigation that prompted the media inquiry from Norway.

connections.description: Media reports cited by a journalist suggest the FBI may be interested in the Crown Princess in connection with the Epstein investigation, implying a potential social or travel link being investigated.

events.title: Media Inquiry Regarding Epstein and Norwegian Royalty
events.description: Norwegian journalist Runa Fjellanger contacts the FBI's National Press Office to ask if the FBI wants to speak with a Norwegian citizen and Crown Princess Mette-Marit regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, citing a tip to the FBI's Stockholm office.

events.title: Internal FBI Coordination on European Media Tip
events.description: FBI personnel in New York (SSA Squad C-20) and the FBI Legat in Copenhagen exchange emails to discuss and coordinate a response to the media inquiry from Norway about Epstein-related interests in Europe.

keyFacts: A Norwegian journalist inquired if the FBI wanted to speak with Crown Princess Mette-Marit of Norway in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.
The inquiry was based on a media report citing an anonymous FBI agent at the U.S. embassy in Stockholm.
The FBI's Crimes Against Children/Human Trafficking squad in New York stated they were unaware of any current interest in Norway regarding the case.
The email chain reveals the FBI's National Press Office and its legal attach√© (Legat) in Copenhagen were involved in handling international media inquiries about the Epstein case.
The document indicates the Epstein case was receiving more media attention in Europe than in the U.S. as of December 2019.
